channel.title: Blogs on Corinna's Data Website
channel.description: Recent content in Blogs on Corinna's Data Website

item.title: Changes in Crop Yield
item.description:
library(tidyverse) library(gganimate) fertilizer <- read_csv("fertilizer.csv") grain <- read_csv("grain.csv") 1.Patterns in Yield over Time yield_animate <- ggplot(grain, aes(x = year, y = yield)) + geom_line(aes(color = commodity)) + facet_wrap(~commodity, scale = "free") + guides(color = FALSE) + labs(x = "
Year", y = "Yield (bushels / acre)
", title = "U.S. Production of Four Crops (1866 - 2018)
") + theme_classic() + transition_reveal(commodity, year) yield_animate The trend in barley is best described by a linear, low plateau (LLP) model.

item.title: Snowshoe Hares
item.description: Snowshoe hares are prevalent in northern boreal forests, such as those in Alaska. Capture-release studies conducted from 1999 to 2002 in Alaskaâ€™s Bonanza Creek Experimental Forest collected physical data on this species (Kielland et al., 2017). This project visualizes snowshoe hare weights in a box-and-whisker plot with a jitter overlay. It also provides some summary statistics on snowshow hare weights. This project showcases my data visualization work with figures and tables.
